paper_title.ja: Athlete experience in the adolescence and persistent exercise habits enhance orthostatic tolerance in the elderly
paper_title.en: Athlete experience in the adolescence and persistent exercise habits enhance orthostatic tolerance in the elderly.

description.ja: 老年者における思春期青年期のスポーツ競技生活の有無とその後の運動実施継続の有無によつて生ずる直立保持機構の差異を, 重心動揺測定による平衡機能検査と能動的および準受動的循環機能起立検査を使用して検討した. その結果, 高運動実施群は平衡機能の内でも特に筋制御において低運動実施群より優れ, また, 弾性のある血管を持つとともに交感神経系の反応性も高く, より若い体を保持していることが明らかになつた. このことから, 思春期青年期においての運動による体力の増強と生涯を通じての継続的かつ適度な運動があいまつて, ヒトの基本的な機能である立つ能力 (直立能力) の老化防止に有効なことが示唆された.
description.en: To examine the effects of athlete experience in the adolescence and persistent exercise habits on the orthostatic tolerance in the elderly, equilibrium tests by the statokinesimetry and active as well as semipassive (leaning on the wall) standing tests were loaded on the six athlete elderly and four non-athlete elderly. The shift length of the center of gravity was measured during one-footed standing, and two-footed standing with their eyes open and closed. The shift length of the athlete group was significantly shorter than that of non-athletes, suggesting that athletes have a good equilibrium function. In the standing tests, heart rate and blood pressure were measured before and two minutes after the standing. Heart rate (HR) of the athletes increased by 12% by active standing, but no significant changes were observed in the non-athletes. Systolic (SBP), diastolic (DBP), and pulse pressures increased in both groups, but athletes showed less blood pressure rise than non-athletes. Cardiovascular index of deconditioning, calculated as ΔHR-ΔSBP+ΔDBP, were determined in athletes and non-athletes. Although, no significant difference was observed, the index was lower in the athletes, suggesting that athletes had a lower heart rate response and lower pulse pressure difference in semi-passive standing. These results indicates that athletes have higher vascular compliance than non-athletes. It is concluded that athlete experience and persistent exercise habits enhances orthostatic tolerance in the elderly.

paper_title.ja: 老年者における青年期の運動競技経験とその後の運動習慣による起立耐性の促進
paper_title.en: Athlete experience in the adolescence and persistent exercise habits enhance orthostatic tolerance in the elderly.

The shift length of the center of gravity was measured during one-footed standing, and two-footed standing with their eyes open and closed. These results indicates that athletes have higher vascular compliance than non-athletes. It is concluded that athlete experience and persistent exercise habits enhances orthostatic tolerance in the elderly.
